intro: Alibertia occidentalis, commonly known as wild betony, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers. Its roots are extensively branched and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
